website_summaries.verdict: When it comes to size, weight capacity, and quality of construction, this camping hammock is one of the best for the price.
pros: This dual single and double 10-foot camping hammock is designed for optimum comfort for big and tall campers
cons: Because of the hammocks spacious size, a small person will tend to get tangled in the folds

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: This is a large hammock and very comfortable for my 6’ 290 lb frame. Besides the width and length one of the main comfort points I am impressed with is its strength. After the first few moments of swinging then getting in and out several times I felt confident it would support my weight without issue allowing me to enjoy relaxing in it. The only con in my opinion is I felt the mosquito net support lines included are a little short. Easy enough to replace with some longer 550 cord. Overall this hammock is an excellent deal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: andre betancourt

customer_reviews.title: Great choice all around
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing hammock. I had nothing but great experiences with it. Easy to setup, easy to take down, no complaints at all. The straps are a nice touch, and everything fits into the little bag hanging off the side. The netting is attached to the hammock. You'll need a rain fly seperately
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Tyrone A. Steele

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Massive hammock, I purchased three intending for each member of the party to bunk alone. However the hammock was so roomy the hubs and I ended up bunking together with the dog at our feet. Super comfortable, would highly recommend! Only issue was one of the hammocks arriving with torn (mis-cut?) loops for hanging the mosquito net. Stitching them myself was easier than exchanging, so no big complaint there. Also super easy to hang! Loved the easy, dummy proof, loops running the length of the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Kimma

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is my first hammock and it was very easy to setup. I spent an entire week at scout camp using it and it was very confortable. It will be my main platform for sleeping on camping trips from now on. My only complaint is that the re is only one interior pouch for holding items making it mandatory which end your head is at, at least if you want easy access to what you put in the pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Vassternich

customer_reviews.title: Zipper on netting broke during first use
customer_reviews.text: Love the hammock but the very first time I used the netting the zipper broke. I’m very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Jean Kovar

customer_reviews.title: Great hammock
customer_reviews.text: Nice camping hammock. It is designed well and fairly easy to set up after the first time. The straps are very well made and make it easy to secure to a tree. They have a lot of loops so it is easy to adjust the height. I recommend testing the height & laying in it the first time before running the guide lines for the mosquito net. The hammocks may stretch a little when you first put weight on it. Also, I highly recommend using a sleeping bag when camping and not blankets. Always make sure the netting is above your sleeping bag before getting in the hammock. The pockets are very handy. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Honestly this is much smaller than I anticipated. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this is much smaller than I anticipated. It looks massive in the photo - and the description seems to advertise a much larger product. I am 5'11 - 150 lbs - I just barely fit into this thing. I'm wondering if they sent me the wrong size or something...
customer_reviews.author: tim daly

customer_reviews.title: The hammock is priced right and comes with everything you ...
customer_reviews.text: The hammock is priced right and comes with everything you need, unfortunately after a 4 day camping trip the mosquito net had already torn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the bug net
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up if you have ever used a hammock before. It is comfortable, though the sides want to fold in on your face. The netting was snagged, and snags very easily - be careful when hanging this. Do not let it touch the ground, or you risk snagging the netting. Also, make sure you find a tree with limbs that extend out, or the netting will just bunch up and fall into your face. Good hammock, the pictures show that it will fit two people, but I do not think that two normal sized people would be comfortable sitting it in.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Denbow

customer_reviews.title: but it is much easier and faster with these and they easily adjust to the different tree gaps
customer_reviews.text: If you have a lot of trees around, there is no real problem setting up. Be sure to not cinch it too tight as it stretches when you get in. If you are not around a lot trees, the screen tends fall on top. In retrospect, I likely would get one with the built-in loop that keep the screen from falling on you. This isn't a big deal. NOTE: The straps are a must have! Either find a cot that offers them, or buy them. Yes, you can use some rope and get it to work, but it is much easier and faster with these and they easily adjust to the different tree gaps.
customer_reviews.author: Texazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice set up.
customer_reviews.text: This whole setup is really nice. The straps are webbing, rather than rope, so they are really strong and not harmful to trees. The carabiners are non-snag. It's easy to use. Comfortable. Has a nice inner pocket (for essential items like glasses, car keys, etc.) in addition to the attached pocket it stuffs into. Only drawback is that there is pretty much no way the whole set will pack back into the pocket. The mosquito net is held up by strings that don't have clips, but if you can tie a half hitch or safety knot (or your shoes), you are in business.
customer_reviews.author: LEE

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it. The material is perfect for my situation and environment here in the coastal island chain of Alaska. Perfect summer tool im stoked to use it. Ive tested this thing pretty legit. Dont smoke in it, youl be fine. Oh and dont be dumb and sleep with your knife or itl be your fault you tore your bag. Other than that, youl be fine. Shipping was wierd. No notifications and stuck on saying coming sunday atleast 3 days ago. Then shows up day before. I love my product so im just sayin hey Amazon, keep record of this incase you follow up.
customer_reviews.author: Nonya

customer_reviews.title: I found myself slipping into the banana position which is painful while you are sleeping
customer_reviews.text: This hammock is decent. I slept in it for two nights in NH but at 6'2" this hamock was to small to sleep diagonally on. I found myself slipping into the banana position which is painful while you are sleeping. perhaps the two person size will give me enough room to sleep sideways?
customer_reviews.author: Khan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bang for your buck. Good alternative to ENOs. Fly net does not come off though.
customer_reviews.text: I got this double nest hammock for my brother-in-law as a gift as a much cheaper alternative to an ENO. Everything with the product was excellent. My only complaint is the fly net is attached to the hammock, so you have to have it on at all times. I was under the impression that you can zip it off of both sides, but it is sewn to one side permanently. Other than that it’s a great product and my brother-in-law loved it. I have an ENO and there are VERY few differences between the two.
customer_reviews.author: Avalon

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito netting started ripping next to zipper.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a little over a month before my trip, really wish I didn't as a started ripping on me in a mosquito infested area and started getting bit up now Amazon says I can't return this as it's been more than a month stupidly ridiculous. How am I supposed to return this when I'm in the middle of the forest.
customer_reviews.author: bean

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camping Hammock
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I've been looking for very quick and easy to setup. I like the simplicity of running the included nylon rope through the loops on the mosquito net. I bought the double wide hammock for myself just to have some extra room. You could definitely fit two people in it i just don't know how comfortable that would be. It fairly light weight and the bag you pack it into is part of the hammock so you'll never lose it. The adjustable strap is plenty long enough for varying distances

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the Sunyear
customer_reviews.text: I was very dissatisfied when I ordered an Ezfull hammock. I ordered a double hammock with mosquito net and tree straps. I received a single hammock with bug net, no tree staps, just ropes and cheap carabiners. No name brand on the bag. I sent back the order and Amazon credited my account. I reordered the same EZfull and it never did ship out after two weeks. Cancelled again. Then I ordered the same hammock from Sunyear and I got exactly what I ordered. Very happy with the Sunyear. The Sunyear hammock is well made, the right length, and should work well for the camping I have planned for this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Roger C.

customer_reviews.title: Really Low quality
customer_reviews.text: It ripped the first time we used it. It tore right down the middle when I got into and I’m 120lbs. I’ve been traveling for work after our camping trip so I missed my window to return it. Such a disappointment in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: V. T.Le

customer_reviews.title: Like being stuck at the bottom of an envelope
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to hang (although the cords to suspend the mosquito net are too short). But once you are in, you are completely enveloped by it and can only see a slit of trees above you. Seems risky to not be able to see around you when using it in the wilderness. It is large, as promised, but the two of us were squished together at the bottom of it and barely able to move.
customer_reviews.author: Ylfa Yr Perry

customer_reviews.title: hammock camping at its finest!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the first 1 came without the tree straps. I returned that one. But I liked it allot so I ordered another two. one for me and one for my wife we both love them. Took both camping the setup was fast and easy everything worked perfectly I used a blow up sleeping pad and with the double wide hammock it was the best night sleep you could possibly ask for. Very good hammock and very strong. All and all it is a high quality purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SentientBeing

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit, very lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Nice hammock; very lightweight; easy set-up. Minor criticism: the zipper is not robust; we'll see how long it lasts. Also, the handy attached stow bag is clever, but it does not all fit back in there. The makers must be very good at rolling tightly. The material is so light, a mosquito can penetrate it. Otherwise, it is a nice, clever design. Light is good for most backpacking needs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very niiiiccceee banana hammock. I mean hammock.
customer_reviews.text: Very small package. Fits in bookbag with lots of other stuff easily. I'm worried about durability but just cause its lightweight... but It comes with warranty so hopefully if it does break or rip they will replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: It's super wide but the straps attached to the netting are not very hardy
customer_reviews.text: We love our red and black hammock. The bug net is great and its very much wide enough to hold my husband and I. I'm sure we could fit a small child in there with us as well. It's super easy to set up but the little straps that are attached to the cords that keep the netting up are not very sturdy and I've had to handstitch a few of them back together using waxed thread. I suggest that you double stitch them before using them.
customer_reviews.author: Thea S

customer_reviews.title: Good quality hammock for the money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I wanted a hammock with netting. I couldn't be happier with my purchase. The hammock seems very well constructed, seams are sewn good, straps are good quality. Compared with my Eno Hammock, it seems to be of similar quality. The bag fits everything back in it, although it is just enough room. Might replace the netting strings with some 550cord, but other than that I am really happy with it. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: jovial

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!!
customer_reviews.text: After my first use I’m very happy with the performance and consider this an excellent value. Me and some buddies did an overnight kayak/camping trip and it worked great. At 230 lbs it supported me easily and the netting ensured I wasn’t bitten by one mosquito while in my hammock. After seeing how much my friends paid for their hammocks at REI I feel like I made a smart decision. One person paid more for just the tree straps than I paid for this whole setup. Hopefully it will last several seasons if I take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: njsteve

customer_reviews.title: Bugs can still bite you through the hammock fabric
customer_reviews.text: One thing I did not think about when getting the all in one hammock is you can still easily get bit through the hammock fabric. The net is nice but any exposed skin against the hammock itself is susceptible. I have a couple hammock nets that go around the entire hammock. Those are much better, but this is nice as another option. Colder nights wrapped in a blanket IN the hammock. Then you don't have to worry about bug bites.
customer_reviews.author: Austin S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Hammocks I have owned!
customer_reviews.text: The hammock is perfect super easy to hang up and super sturdy when using and I know cuz I am a heavy guy who weighs 240 pounds and it holds me up super well, been using it when I go to the beach with my friends and my girl and they love it so much I’m pretty sure I’m getting one for my girl soon so we can go camping. If you’re thinking about it buy it you won’t regret it and it packs up so well I keep it in my car all the time because of the little space it takes.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Quijano

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for buggy camping trips
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for buggy camping trips.Sleeps pretty good too! The double hammock is big enough for my 6'4" husband. The straps are well made and durable, and they make setting up and adjusting the hammocks a breeze. When it's hot and muggy out, it gets to warm with the net closed, so you need clothes pins or something else to hold the net open.
customer_reviews.author: The Cake Lady

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love this hammock!!! It is small enough to just keep in my car should I need or want to use it, the setup takes less than 5 minutes if you're not using the bug net (only slightly longer if you are) and it will fit both me and my s/o fairly comfortably once we get situated. (We haven't tried overnight yet though). Overall very happy and look forward to getting more in the future for the rest of our family!
customer_reviews.author: Penelope

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, takes a little trust to get into this and relax , it defies reason that this material by the looks of it would hold up. After multiple days of camping it held up , worked as described. Only issue I can say .. for some reason it seems to attract bugs , so while you're well protected by the screen net , seemed bombarded with flies and mosquitoes buzzing constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cherwinski

customer_reviews.title: Camping hanmock
customer_reviews.text: Just received hammock. Best purchase we’ve made in awhile. Should have gotten 2. Everyone fighting over getting in it. Comfortable relaxing and mosquito net the best!!
customer_reviews.author: jill aspinwall

customer_reviews.title: Customer service was amazing!
customer_reviews.text: So customer service was amazing! Super fast to respond and great at fixing the problem at hand! Will definitely look around the yard to see if I can find another spot for a hammock. Bought a single for me and my young boys to read in. They love it, and I love escaping to it after they’re in bed. Love the little pocket. Bug net it a great feature and easy to use or not use. The set up is super fast and easy and I feel very confident in its longevity and ability to withstand the elements. However, get a tarp or take it down easy every night if you want. Highly recommended over any other hammock on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Kimmel

customer_reviews.title: Used on trail: Great Option!
customer_reviews.text: I used the single Sun Year hammock with bug night on the ice age trail. Easy to set up and the bug net will be super helpful in warmer weather. I used a sleeping mat and underquilt as temps dropped to around 40 degrees and I was comfy, snug and warm all night. Hammock is a great option for those who want to get into hammock camping as it’s compact and easy to set up. There are lot of other super light weight options, so only thing to consider is this hammock is a bit more weight than some others. All in all, I’m very happy with this hammock and want to get back into it soon.
customer_reviews.author: DPenn

customer_reviews.title: Best for Hammock Camping
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love this hammock! It's high-quality and perfect for hammock camping. I've spent over 50 nights in this thing and had a blast. The setup/tear-down can take a while (if using the bug net), even after doing it a ton of times. Tree straps are study. Bug net never let bugs in, and the zippers held. I even flipped over one night accidentally and the bug net didn't rip at all - it held all 180lbs of me.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah

customer_reviews.title: This hammock rocks... literally!
customer_reviews.text: This hammock is lighter than a conventional tent and much more comfortable. I am 6'3" 240 lbs and the two person size is plenty enough for me, and I could definitely an average sized woman with me. I love it! I have only set it up and tried it once so I will update if anything changes as time goes on, but I suspect from the initial test it will be great.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Chester

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: As I am writing this review, I had to request a product exchange since the one I currently have has broken. The hammoc is supported on each end by four thick ropes that clip onto the straps on the tree. I noticed that two of those ropes on each end broke off leaving the hammoc uneven and less supported. Aside from that, it's very comfortable and set up is a breeze that takes no time at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota W.

customer_reviews.title: Vary good budget hammock
customer_reviews.text: Pretty lit, went up a couple 14ers over the last few weekends. I bought the recommended tarp/fly for it and stayed dry during hard rain in the mountains. Friend bought this hammock off of my recommendation and it worked well for him. In the cold make sure to use a thick sleeping pad or a blow up one like I used was perfect. The mosquitos could only glare at me from a safe distance away and the few spiders couldn't get in.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Lahti

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My teens love these hammocks, which allow them to have some independence while we camp. They are easy to set up and for/hold both kids - one who is six feet tall / adult sized and the other who is five feet and petite. They had no trouble setting them up, and the straps that come with the hammocks are durable. We bought separate tarps for each one to help with insulation and protect from moisture. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Burns

customer_reviews.title: Finally a true double hammock!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic hammock. A true double!! Many other sellers list their hammock as 2 person or double hammock, but were only 50 inches wide! This one is almost 80 inches wide!! Finally a hammock wide enough for me to lay the correct way! I couldn't be happier, the construction seems very good, and the tree straps are excellent too. It's a bit heavier than your typical backpacking hammock, but it was worth it to me to sleep more comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Strong net got put to the test! Plus new carabiners!
customer_reviews.text: Field tested a couple times, one of which (be mindful I'm new in hammocking) I accidentally rolled in the hammock UPSIDE DOWN and was left hanging in the misquito net! I thought for sure the net would rip when if flipped, but to my surprise not even a tear, not the net, stiching, or anything. The zipper is of moderate quality if anything that could be better, but that's it. Also, those plastic carabiners in the picture, have been updated. It came with 2 very nice metal ones, they seem heavier duty than the ones you buy at cabellas or Walmart. For 25 bucks, very worth it. Oh ya, and double and triple stitching on everything. Muy Beuno.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Fichtner

customer_reviews.title: mosquito netting ripped after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: The mosquito netting might as well have been made from spider webs, as it ripped beyond repair after two 5 minute uses by a 100 lb young woman taking a nap. Also, before this, the mosquito netting bunched together. The video suggested "putting some sticks in it" to keep it stretched out, which is lame and of course didn't work at all--sticks popped right out. Next hammock won't have mosquito netting--despite being a great idea, it seems too fragile and hard to pull off in reality.
customer_reviews.author: gennine zinner

customer_reviews.title: Must have for camping!
customer_reviews.text: The netting isn't as confining as I thought it would be and its easier on the bugs too! I placed a packing blanket in the hammock to lay on which was way more comfortable than my yoga mat for sleeping and colder weather. This is lightweight, compact, super easy to set up, great price, top of the line construction and IMMENSELY therapeutic. You won't be sorry..I sigh just thinking about my naps in my hammock. JAZZ HANDS HAPPY
customer_reviews.author: L Morgan Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Large enough for you and gear
customer_reviews.text: Really like this hammock,i bought the double for the extra room. So i could keep my pack in it with me,because the places i camp are abundant with snakes. And it's no fun to wakeup in the morning and have to dig one out of your gear. This hammock is large enough i can sleep comfortably with all my gear in it with me. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vic68

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Ssoo ridiculously uncomfortable. The sides are too tight, or shortin length, I think is the issue. Sitting in it is uncomfortable and sleeping in it left all of my joints aching so so bad the next day (I'm 28 with no regular joint issues). Super durable, super lightweight, very easy to install. But I'll be upgrading to a more expensive one as soon as I can and cutting this one up to use as a tarp/windscreen of sorts.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Cool Breeze Blows under you in the summertime
customer_reviews.text: Just tried this out the other day had it probably a month very strong easy to hang up had no problem with links on the strings that hold the net up durability I think if you wasn't careful you could snag it easily comfort quality I had no problem with I think it's a good product lightweight comfortable just use a little common sense and not hang it by a bunch of Breyers are cactus should have no problem
customer_reviews.author: just a vapor

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well this elk hunting season. after about the 4th weekend of use it has stretched some and the results are a few extra minutes to set it up to make sure everything hangs right for a comfortable nights sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Why do you care

customer_reviews.title: Great hammock for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Took this hammock on an overnight backpacking trip. First time I have ever owned or setup a hammock. Loved it for sure! The hammock feels like it's decent quality and was very easy to setup. The tree straps make it a breeze to setup, although they do add quite a bit of weight to the setup. The bug net is a no brainier, loved laying in the hammock without any issues from the ants that were all over the tree. Plus if you are at a park or your backyard or somewhere that's not as big of an issue, just set the hammock up upside down and use it as normal.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Tore 😔
customer_reviews.text: I weight 170 pounds. Used it maybe 3 times and tore just today. Kinda just got up and laughed lol. Could just been a minor manufacturer problem I don’t know. It was comfy, just a shame it tore.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden Lukes

customer_reviews.title: Stargaze
customer_reviews.text: So if you are looking for something to avoid mosquitos.. this isn’t it. The mosquitos have targeted my butt and thighs instead! Other than that it is comfy to a point, I wouldn’t sleep in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This hammock looks great and I was impressed with the how it came ! The seller got in contact with me very quickly after I got my package and the tree straps were missing. I was very impressed with how kind they were and prompt with sending me a replacement! I got it set up and laid in it for a good hour and loved it! The sides were very high and being as short as I am, it was a bit difficult for me to get out because I couldn't reach the ground but over all it's amazing. As soon as the weather clears up and I can hang it up again I will post some additional photos.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality hammock
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hammock, easy to set up and comfortable. Setting up the bug net enclosure was also very easy .... the pictures make it look extensive but it’s quick and painless.
customer_reviews.author: ADK

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Mosquito net cleverly done. Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my daughter's au pair. The hammock is well made, and the mosquito netting is cleverly suspended. The kids love it, and both were in the hammock with the au pair. My daughter said she's seen quite a few of these used backpacking in Utah. Recommended. Attached is a photo showing the au pair and my granddaughter (sitting up) in the small size hammock under the mosquito net. The au paid is about 5'3" tall. Granddaughter is 4 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Ranchodoug

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up!
customer_reviews.text: I am 240lb guy and only got in and out of it a couple of times, then inspected. I found multiple small tears. I was extremely careful getting in and out. Maybe not so good for a heavy person.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS SO WORTH THE MONEY- only 1 flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hammock because I camp a lot and am tired of carrying a cot-tent around with me due to it's weight. I used this item for my first time this weekend. This is an awesome product with a super easy set-up. I slept great. I only flaw I see is the mosquito net tears kind of easy. Mine tore when I went to sit in the hammock with the mosquito net up. I thought my butt is inside the hammock when I went to sit down, but I accidently sat on the net and it tore right in half. I weigh 220 6'2". I also don't know how to request an exchange. Buy this is an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Lawrey Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I set my hammock up for the first time today. It appears to have very good quality. No issue out of the box. The hammock itself and the bug net seem really good, I might be concerned about the zipper. My last hammock lasted ten years. I feel as though the zipper on the net won't last that long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. It's super easy to put up. As someone who has never used or hung a hammock, I was very concerned about the lack of hanging supplies. But this was extremely easy, and I felt safe and sturdy. Immediately got in with my boyfriend, and we both felt safe. The bug net is a great feature, and there are little bags with zippers on the outside and inside for your stuff. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: CKeith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hammock for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an all-in-one hammock so worth the money I have slept comfortable in it since the first night I set it up the only thing I don't like about it is it needs an extra tulips sewn into the center of the netting because if not the netting falls down in your face that is the only thing I would change which I did on mine
customer_reviews.author: jason tucker

customer_reviews.title: Sorry for return 😒
customer_reviews.text: Material very thin, too thin for my liking. Returned. Sorry bout dat. I hate to return
customer_reviews.author: Jerry W.

customer_reviews.title: Room for Improvement
customer_reviews.text: Mosquito netting design needs spreaders and the loop points are setup to string out to additional tie off points. No option for running an internal ridgeline for lights or gear inside netting. 6'2" 245lbs got the double very comfortable. For my first hammock overall happy.
customer_reviews.author: DZM

customer_reviews.title: Camping in Colorado
customer_reviews.text: Used this hammock camping in Colorado! Everything was great! Set up was easy, I purchased this so both my spouse and I could sit in the hammock together. I am 5”8 and my spouse is 5”6 together we are 340 lbs and everything was fine. Took a few naps in it, held up great! Great product! But net works well!
customer_reviews.author: B. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great for price.
customer_reviews.text: The nylon/polyester fabric is very thin. Take care that there is not anything poking out of your pockets or you will rip right through. Also the bug netting is very thin, you must be sure not to catch it in the zipper or else you will render it useless with a large hole.
customer_reviews.author: nicholas green

customer_reviews.title: Contact and keeps bugs away
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable hammocks keeps biting bugs away. I gave 4 star durability because I haven’t had it for long. But it’s well-made, hanging loops are thick and has nylon straps for hanging if necessary. I use it on backyard on hammock stand.
customer_reviews.author: Gallstone

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy again
customer_reviews.text: It has held up for 2 week trek across contry for me and big net is life saver. It's bulky but worth it. Straps are great. Could use some tie out points to keep hammok from crowding you. But i like it and it serves purpose.
customer_reviews.author: W.B.Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to set up, comfortable, great value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 hammocks for camping and the experience was much better than I expected. Very fast to set up and pack up for backpacking. Mosquito netting is a must for me camping by the rivers. These hammocks are well made, light weight, and surprisingly comfortable to sleep in. These hammocks are a great value. Makes backpacking more enjoyable because of the ease of set up, instead of dealing with tent set up. Highly recommend these hammocks with bug nets.
customer_reviews.author: malcolm kevin mclees

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift for an Outdoorsman!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my brother who spends his summers in Wyoming! He loves it! Keeps the mosquitos off him while he’s snoozing away, dangling in the trees. The straps are thick and high quality, plus they don’t tear up the trees while you dangle from them. Must have!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Hosey

customer_reviews.title: A must have for outdoor living
customer_reviews.text: Very spacious and the best thing is the mosquito net keeping the bugs out. I hung it 9-10ft apart and its perfect. You can actually pull on the string on the mosquito net to make it swing. The material is a little thin so it’s prone to get rip if precaution is not taken. For the best this is the best bang for the buck. Will certainly rebuy and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Hau Q. Che

customer_reviews.title: Great hammock
customer_reviews.text: After trying out a not so great hammock, I did a little research on what I actually wanted in hammock, and this product didn't disappoint. The included tree straps make set-up a breeze and kept it from sagging. Very comfortable to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Green

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I have the double and my FIL has the single. Has been out camping for a total of 5 nights so far with no issue beyond 1 of the bug net cord loops tearing its stitching. I'm 6'3" 265lbs, and it's also had 6 first graders in it furiously swinging.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but poorly stitched
customer_reviews.text: The comfort was great it worked okay but I'm giving it one star because the bug net ripped the first time I used it in 2 spots which sucked with the mosquitoes I camp miles into the woods for hunting and always use hammocks never had a net rip like this one did
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed very happy
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammock it is easy to setup light weight durable the negative reviews are people that are totally wrong this hammock is very good quality. Update mosquito net ripped sunyear has super fast customer service and sent me a new one thank you sunyear.
customer_reviews.author: Eric keck

customer_reviews.title: DROPPED
customer_reviews.text: Hammock set up is fast and simple. The hammock dropped me on my second night in the woods with nothing to sleep in.. sucky. The seam between the hammock and the bug net ripped and I was on the ground. Spend a few extra bucks and sleep with the peace of mind; that you arent gonna fall on your butt... ha!
customer_reviews.author: Draven Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this! Unfortunately he has now taken up camp in the backyard and refuses to leave, communicating in grunts and noises and attacking unless you have food with you.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly zielinski

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Not much room for two but it is still pretty nice for camping. Easy set up
customer_reviews.author: Chloë

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: I have used this twice so far and I love it. Like others I decided to replace the cords for the bug net with something longer. I am a larger guy and this is very comfortable and secure. I have found it very easy to set up. The only issue I've had is that in my own moving around trying to settle in for the night I ripped the inner pocket off. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: BeeGee

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, compact, easy installation and double side zipper. However!
customer_reviews.text: I just received the product yesterday. I like this lightweight and easy installation. The nylon was comfortable and i liked the double side zipper. However, I found this small hole on the net while testing it out at home. Now, i have concern with the net strength. That's critical to take the bugs away.
customer_reviews.author: goomiu

customer_reviews.title: Sweet hammock
customer_reviews.text: Nice hammock with all the straps you need to quickly hang it. After you’ve set it up a couple times it will only take you a minute or two. Then it all collapses in to its own attached storage bag. Bug screen is nice if you need it or you can just not hang it if you don’t.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool and easy easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Have this thing hanging between two trees for months now. No tears or holes and it's been thru about 10 heavy thunder storms. Plus it goes back into the entire thing fits back into the pouch in about 5 minutes or less
customer_reviews.author: Smokey808

customer_reviews.title: This was an awesome buy but....
customer_reviews.text: It ripped on the first use! I have not been in contact with the company...I hope to do that this week. We got it in last week, my son took it camping over the weekend and it ripped. It was spacious, well made (so it looked) and a great price. All of the attachments were great and easy to use. I am going to take pictures and send to the seller to see if there is anything that we can do about a replacement. I was so looking forward to writing a great review and I hope to be able to amend this one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Can take a snooze without the bugs.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the large size hammock and just set up it. We (6'1" couple weighing approximately 170 lbs each) were able to fit without an issue. The material is light weight and somewhat durable. We will update this review if we have concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: Good hammock especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Its long enough to make it easier to lay flatter I slept great in it as well. The straps for hanging are awesome, the style is among some of the easiest I have ever used for adjusting the strap length. the only thing that I dont really like about it, is the netting is not able to fold back out of the way due to the design
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: Camping hammock
customer_reviews.text: I used the hammock one night and can’t complain I setup after hrs 11pm and wasn’t difficult easy setup I also got the slim air mattress is a plus ever all is a good purchase I can’t not say anything about durability but I hope is good also
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The one I got was well made light but strong. Went hunting climbed a tree stayed there all day at almost night I set up the hammock 30 feet in a tree got in with my harness still attached. It never broke I don’t recommend doing that but goes to show it’s sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Rajeshram Sadhu

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our troop was going backpacking so my boy decided that he wanted to take a hammock on the trip. It is quick and easy to set up, packs up small and he reports a good night's sleep. We just need to find a nice lightweight tarp to serve as a rain fly.
customer_reviews.author: Laura H.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of having the bug net already connected. One less thing to bring/carry. And if you d9nt need to use it just flip the hammock the other way and its completely out of the way. Going to order another for sure. May order the double just because it's only a few bucks more!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Had High Expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after seen good Reviews, but when i Received it, honestly it looked used. It came in a zip lock bag, the rope where all Tangled and the hammock was just Shoved in the bag. The quality definitely didn’t and feel like in the pictures. Going to return.
customer_reviews.author: Akshay Soni

customer_reviews.title: The best sleep in the field hands down
customer_reviews.text: I often have to work in field conditions (military), and this hammock was awesome and easy to throw up in 5min or so exactly what you need when you need to sleep but may have to pack up and move on short notice. Recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Love this hammock
customer_reviews.text: Love this hammock. I bought extra chord and carabiners to run through the loops on the mesh netting, and made a way to keep the top half expanded so it stays more open rather than the cocooning effect it has when you lay in it. Great product overall
customer_reviews.author: restless

customer_reviews.title: Great hammock.
customer_reviews.text: It’s super easy to hang, super comfortable, feels very durable and exactly as pictured. The mosquito net comes in handy right now with the summer weather. We have it under a tree so there’s lots of bugs.
customer_reviews.author: N. D.

customer_reviews.title: Girlfriend loves it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my girlfriend. She's 5'3" and claims it to be very comfortable for her. It seems very sturdy, and setting it up is ridiculously easy. Anyone can figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kaminski

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This has been hanging up in our yard holding up nicely even when we forget to take it down in wind and rain. It’s strong and sturdy. Have spent a lot of time relaxing in this hammock. It has the bug netting which is nice
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Petter

customer_reviews.title: Elite total scumbag
customer_reviews.text: This hammock was awesome at first sight. Love the size and the comfortability with my lady friend. If the hammock would have lasted longer I would be more impressed. It hasn't failed me completely yet but I have noticed some separating at the seams. Granted, I have banged my girlfriend I in this thing at least once.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get we what you pay for... am happy.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried yet, but size and accessories are excellent. Straps are really well constructed, cord for hanging attached netting are plenty long. Initial inspection of hammock and netting seem to be of good quality. Will be taking to Europe for a Camino hike. Will update after use
customer_reviews.author: duncii

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son. He loves camping outside in our backyard. This is very easy for him to assemble, and he claims it is more comfortable than his own bed. The quality has proven to be very durable, and I noticed it is very easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Garcia

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for. Cheap but flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: The hammock is lightweight and easy to carry and setup. However, the big net is flimsy and the hammock is too small/narrow. Not very wide which doesn’t give much cover like better quality hammocks. You have to be very very gentle getting in and out as the bug net hanging straps are flimsy. If you happen to tie the strings too tight, they rip upon the hammock baring weight. Lastly, the big net hanging string is annoying. They should have just provided clips versus strong that requires tying which can be annoying to undo.
customer_reviews.author: Yamile

customer_reviews.title: Quality hammock!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this hammock on 2 separate backpacking trips so far. I’ve found it to be great quality. Im 240lbs, and the hammock has done a great job for me, and the materials have held up. I’m also glad I got an attached bug net too. It’s a convenient feature....
customer_reviews.author: North country

customer_reviews.title: Nice camping hammock for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this hammock camping for almost a year, and it is still going strong. The tree straps are solid and long, and i have had no issues with them, i replaced the carabiners with wire gate ones several months ago and have not looked back. As with all hammocks you will need an underquilt if you going to use it overnight in temps less than 70. I have not had any issues with the bug net, the zippers, the material or the stitching, and have had some really great times testing it out. I will not be sleeping on the ground outside any time soon. Get the double wide, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Waiting4_2112

customer_reviews.title: Good product and comfy, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and works well, although some of the straps on the bug cover have broke in 2 days. Edit: customer service is great to work with! Fixed the problem right away and is sending a replacement. This has a life time warranty and is covered well. I'm glad I purchased this hammock, also very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy N

customer_reviews.title: Great hammock
customer_reviews.text: Used for first time on camp trip with friends. The bad first. So with tree straps and hammock this can span almost 30 feet. Well I had to span pretty close to that and the ropes for the bug net are only 16 feet long... whats up with that??? Besides that I slept really good in this and have no other complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Guerrette

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but not a two person
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I gave it three stars because there's no way in hell that it's comfortable with two people in it though..
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the price point. Too small for an adult.
customer_reviews.text: Bought on a Prime day deal based on reviews. Quality was great for the price point. I did return it though as it's only 9' long and way too small for anyone other than a child. 10' is the bare minimum for an adult, with 11' being preferred.
customer_reviews.author: SMS HVAC

product_meta.title: Single & Double Camping Hammock with Mosquito/Bug Net, 10ft Hammock Tree Straps and Carabiners, Easy Assembly, Portable Parachute Nylon Hammock for Camping, Backpacking, Survival, Travel & More
product_meta.description:
How To Sleep Like A Baby Everywhere You Go?

With A Sunyear Camping Hammock, Of Course! 

Tired of cheaply made hammocks that won’t even last you through a travel year?

Fed up with annoying bugs and blood sucking mosquitoes ruining your outdoor sleep?

Looking for a multipurpose 2 in 1 camping hammock bed?

Search no more! You have just found the ultimate camping gear. 

Now you can enjoy sleeping under the stars and keep nasty mosquito bites at bay. 

Set It Up, Lie Down & Enjoy – Camping Life Is Easy & Comfortable Again With Sunyear Equipment! 

No matter what you do, no matter who you are, no matter where you go, this camping hammock will go everywhere you go you. Fits in your car, backpack or travel suitcase. 

In less than 5 minutes, you have a sleeping bed or relaxing hammock ready to go. You just need to find 2 trees, use the adjustable straps and carabiners, hang the hammock and enjoy. 

Ideal for men, women, kids, and pets as well. Perfect for camping, hiking, beach excursions, picnics, backyard fun, music festivals, lake fishing trips, traveling, survival, and so much more! 

The large and convenient size along with its up to 500(single)/600(double)lbs support, make this hanging hammock great for more than one person! 

Why Go For A Sunyear Single/Double Camping Hammock?

Because It … 

 … is a true camping hammock, comfy and ultra-resilient. 


 … ensures hassle free assembly and storage. 


 … works as a double lying hammock or sleeping bed! 


 … has an excellent mosquito net to keep bugs and insects out!


 … comes with all the installation tools (carabiners & straps) included. 


What are you waiting for? Get yours today, while supplies last!

Scroll Up & Click Add To Cart Now!
feature_bullets: A TRUE HAMMOCK FOR CAMPING: This is one of those hammocks you can actually sleep in outside. Mosquito Nets And Hammocks Combined protect you from all those creepy crawlers which means a more safer and comfortable trip. The compact& lightweight portable parachute hammock comes in an elegant pouch with all its installation tools. Ideal for solo adventures, camping, hiking, backpacking, travel, emergency.

All THE INSTALLATION TOOLS INCLUDED: Our Mosquito Nylon Hammock comes with 2 easy-setup hammock straps(32 adjustment loops +20ft long combined)+2 carabiners (Single: 2 Solid steel D-shape / Double:2*12KN ultralight &heavy duty carabiners)+2 net ropes at valued more than $22 on Amazon. NO need to buy any other tree straps or carabiners. Save your TIME and MONEY. Perfect gifts for him/her.

FOR SAFE & SOUND SLEEPS: Love into the wild adventures, camping and backpacking, but hate mosquito bites and pesky bugs? If so, then this hammock with bug net is the answer. Use it as a sleeping bed and protect yourself from insect bites. Best gift idea for camping lovers. Flip it over and use it as a relaxing hammock in seconds!

QUALITY MEETS ENDURANCE: Made of high quality 210T parachute nylon materials (the same kind skydivers and eno hammocks use!) )and special designed durable bug net fabric(2 times density than similar products on the market). This lightweight portable hammock is designed to accommodate even your most demanding camping needs.

GET THIS MOSQUITO HAMMOCK RISK FREE: 100% Lifetime Guarantee. Sunyear take pride in top quality products & great customer service. So if you’re not 100% satisfied, don’t hesitate to let us know. We’ll make sure you get a FULL REFUND!

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
